txt.en: Bloody tracks led eastward, away from the river.
Chapter 2.5: Danger Downriver
Find the source of the blood-spattered tracks

'Nothing about these tracks convinces me that the raiding-party changed its chosen course, [placeholder]. We should continue following the river south, but not without caution! Let us remain alert for further sign of the Orcs!'
'Follow the river south, and remain alert for further sign of the Orcs!'
Travel toward the town of Limlók, to the north-east
'Keep following those tracks! I will be right behind you.'
Talk to Venko in view of Limlók
'The village seems safe, for now.'
'There lies the village, but it seems peaceful. We know the raiding-party came this way... but where has it gone?'
You find more tracks in the dirt by Hengi's Leap
The tracks here turn to the TBD
DNT - Blah!
Venko looks out upon the Beorning village of Limlók, the obvious question on his lips: where is the raiding-party?
You find more tracks, but these are speckled with blood
The blood and the footprints both lead eastward
Imák wants you to follow the river southward in search of the raiding-party.
'Or maybe your death will restore my strength, and I will kill him myself!'
By Hengi's Leap you found more tracks left by the raiding-party, but the broken bridge likely prevented them from crossing the river. They may have continued south instead.
A wounded Orc lies within a growing pool of his own blood, at TBD.
Thrúgord spoke of a village of 'Bear-folk' to which the raiding-party planned to go. He must have meant the town of Limlók, to the north-east.
If the raiding-party intended to cross the river here, the broken bridge prevented it
Continue southward along the river in search of more tracks
Continue following the river south in search of more tracks
Hasten the dying Orc on his way
You and your companions discovered evidence that the raiding-party travelled south from the ruins of Framsburg. Where has it now gone?

'Stay back, vermin! You are no better than the treacherous slime that stabbed me, but Natsatúg was surrounded by a company of his fiercest warriors, and you are not!

'They left me here to die, but I have strength enough to cut your throat before my own life ends!'

Thrúgord's head sinks to his chest, and his sudden, barking laugh seems to cause him a great deal of pain. Even so, he bares his teeth in a smile.

'If you are able to slay me, do me this favour: go to the village of the Bear-folk and slay Natsatúg, the wretched villain!'
The Beorning village of Limlók lies peacefully to the north-west
As Thrúgord dies, he bares his fangs at you in a mocking smile
